content: foot note the fsc and the double_crochet we will be doing are a bit stretchy so do not make the fsc-chain too long try on for the perfect fit for my foot i made 23 fsc the un-stretched chain does not go around my ankle at all and that is the way it should be pic 5 1 2 3 4 5 10 close the round with a ldc worked out of the fsc pull up a loop from the back- side of your last fsc you have 2 loops on your hook pics 1 and 2 with the side of the work where you did your last st in colour b facing you pic 3 work a ldc in the next increase-st just to be safe try on again your ●sock● and adjust the lenght of the fsc-chain if necessarys 1 2 3 round 2-14 more or less this is easy work double_crochet not linked in all the stiches around you do not need to close the round the leg is worked in spirals continue until the desired lenghth of the leg i did 14 rounds of double_crochet in the picture you can see the first few double_crochet in my oppinion it is much easier to work your double_crochet into the fsc then into a normal chain keep in mind that the socks are a bit slouchy so try not to make them to short as i wrote 14 rounds wor- ked perfectly for me but maybe you need more or less rounds 11 when you are done stop above the right corner of your sock pic 1 to make a smooth edge work 5 half_double_crochet then 5 single_crochet pic 2 then 1 slip_stitch and fasten_off 12 foot the sole of the foot is made with ldc the top with double_crochet in the first few rounds we will decrease to make the sock fit your foot round 1 switch to colour b you start at your spiral-heel again ldc until 1 st before the corner pic 1 then decrease by working 3 double_crochet decrease put a marker in that decr-st pic 2 continue in double_crochet until you reach the next corner do a decr with 3 double_crochet decrease again then work ldc for the sole until you reach the next corner where we did the 1st decr in the 1st round round 2 and 3 the same as 1 double_crochet on top ldc for the sole decr in the corners 13 note the toe-area will only add about 5 rounds so round 4 - keep that in mind when you try to determine the go on without decreases until your sock has the desired length of your foot length „desired in this case means until you reach the start of your toes si made a sock in size 39 and made 14 rounds if you count the double_crochet on top last round in the last round stop before you begin with the ldc pic 1 count your st for
